recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
In a large pan, cook the ground beef, onion, and garlic until the beef is browned and the onion is translucent.
Add the canned tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over the cooked spaghetti and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
instructions: Heat the sesame oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan.
In the same pan, add the bell peppers, onion, and garlic. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, and red pepper flakes.
Add the cooked chicken back to the pan and pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Serve the chicken stir-fry over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture and mix well.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly golden brown.
Allow cookies to cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

recipes.name: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, mix together the minced garlic, chopped rosemary, chopped thyme, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Rub the mixture all over the chicken, including under the skin and inside the cavity.
Slice one lemon and place the slices and the remaining lemon inside the chicken cavity.
Tie the chicken legs together with kitchen twine.
Place the chicken on a rack in a roasting pan and roast for about 1 hour, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) and the skin is golden brown.
Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving. Serve with roasted vegetables or your choice of sides.

recipes.name: Honey Mustard Chicken
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the Dijon mustard, honey, olive oil, minced garlic, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over the chicken.
Seal the bag and massage the chicken to coat it with the marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or up to 24 hours for maximum flavor.
Preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Remove the chicken from the marinade, allowing any excess marinade to drip off.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
Remove from the grill and let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving. Serve with your choice of sides.

recipes.name: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat the oven to the temperature recommended for the pizza dough.
Roll out the pizza dough into your desired shape and thickness.
Spread the marinara sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a border for the crust.
Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Tear the fresh basil leaves and distribute them over the cheese.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza and season with salt and pepper.
Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for the recommended time or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven, let it cool slightly, and slice before serving.

recipes.name: Tiramisu
instructions: In a heatproof bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until well combined.
Place the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl doesn't touch the water.
Cook the mixture, whisking constantly, until it thickens and becomes pale yellow in color. This usually takes about 5 minutes.
Remove the bowl from the heat and whisk in the milk. Let the mixture cool to room temperature.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the whipped cream into the cooled egg yolk mixture until well combined.
In another bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese and vanilla extract until smooth.
Fold themascarpone mixture into the egg yolk and cream mixture until fully incorporated.
In a shallow dish, pour the cooled brewed coffee.
Dip each ladyfinger into the coffee, allowing them to soak for a few seconds on each side.
Arrange a layer of soaked ladyfingers in the bottom of a serving dish or individual serving glasses.
Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Repeat the layers until all the ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture are used, ending with a layer of mascarpone mixture on top.
Sift the cocoa powder evenly over the top layer of mascarpone.
Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight, to allow the flavors to meld and the tiramisu to set.
Before serving, garnish with additional cocoa powder or grated chocolate, if desired.
Serve chilled and enjoy!

recipes.name: Ugali and Sukuma Wiki
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Gradually add the maize flour to the boiling water while continuously stirring to prevent lumps from forming.
Reduce the heat to low and continue stirring until the mixture thickens and forms a stiff consistency. This is ugali.
In a separate pan, heat the vegetable oil and sauté the onions and garlic until they are golden brown.
Add the diced tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Chop the sukuma wiki into small pieces and add them to the pan. Cook until the greens wilt and become tender.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve the ugali and sukuma wiki together as a traditional Kenyan meal.

recipes.name: Nyama Choma
ingredients: 2 pounds beef or goat meat, cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, combine the vegetable oil, onion, garlic, paprika, cayenne pepper, black pepper, and salt to make a marinade.
Add the meat chunks to the marinade and mix well to ensure the meat is coated evenly. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results.
Preheat the grill or barbecue to medium-high heat.
Thread the meat onto skewers and place them on the grill.
Grill the meat for about 8-10 minutes per side, or until it is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
Remove the skewers from the grill and let the meat rest for a few minutes before serving.
Serve the nyama choma with your favorite Kenyan side dishes, such as ugali, sukuma wiki, or kachumbari (Kenyan salsa).

recipes.name: Mandazi
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and ground cardamom.
In a separate bowl, combine the coconut milk, water, and vegetable oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until a soft dough forms.
Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
Cover the dough with a clean kitchen towel and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Heat the oil for deep frying in a large, deep pot or skillet over medium heat. The oil should be about 2-3 inches deep.
While the oil is heating, roll out the dough to about 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut the dough into desired shapes, such as triangles or squares.
Carefully add the mandazi to the hot oil, a few at a time, and fry until they turn golden brown on both sides. Flip them occasionally to ensure even browning.
Once cooked, remove the mandazi from the oil using a slotted spoon and transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Repeat the frying process until all the dough is used.
Serve the mandazi warm as a snack or breakfast treat. They can be enjoyed plain or dusted with powdered sugar.

recipes.name: Pilau
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the cumin seeds and sauté until they start to sizzle.
Add the chopped onions and cook until they become golden brown.
Add the minced garlic and ginger paste. Cook for an additional minute.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Stir in the pilau masala, turmeric powder, and diced tomatoes. Cook for a few minutes until the tomatoes soften.
Add the basmati rice to the pot and stir well to coat it with the spices.
Pour in the chicken broth and season with salt to taste.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.
Simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and has absorbed the liquid.
Remove from heat and let the pilau rest for 5 minutes before fluffing it with a fork.
Serve the pilau hot as a main dish or as a side with your favorite accompaniments.

recipes.name: Nyama Ya Kukaanga
ingredients: 1 kg beef or goat meat, cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onions and cook until they become translucent.
Add the minced garlic and ginger paste. Cook for an additional minute.
Add the diced tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Add the beef or goat meat chunks to the pan and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Stir in the paprika, curry powder, turmeric powder, black pepper, and salt.
Cover the pan and simmer for about 1 to 1.5 hours, or until the meat is tender.
Check the seasoning and adjust as needed.
Remove from heat and let the nyama ya kukaanga rest for a few minutes before serving.
Serve the dish hot with rice, chapati, or ugali.

recipes.name: Mahamri
ingredients: 2 tablespoons melted butter or vegetable oil
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, yeast, ground cardamom, ground cinnamon, and salt.
Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the coconut milk, warm water, and melted butter or vegetable oil.
Mix the ingredients together to form a soft dough. Knead the dough for about 5-7 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Cover the bowl with a clean kitchen towel and let the dough rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it doubles in size.
After the dough has risen, punch it down to release any air bubbles.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to about 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut the dough into small triangular or square shapes.
In a large, deep pan or skillet, heat the oil for frying over medium heat.
Carefully add the mahamri to the hot oil, a few at a time, and fry until they turn golden brown on both sides. Flip them occasionally to ensure even frying.
Once cooked, remove the mahamri from the oil using a slotted spoon and transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Repeat the frying process until all the dough is used.
Serve the mahamri warm as a breakfast or snack. They are often enjoyed with tea or coffee.
You can also serve them with coconut chutney or your favorite dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Classic Cheeseburger
ingredients: Lettuce, tomato, onion, and condiments for toppings
instructions: Preheat a grill or stovetop griddle over medium-high heat.
Divide the ground beef into four equal portions and shape them into patties.
Season the patties with salt and pepper on both sides.
Place the patties on the grill or griddle and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheese on each patty and allow it to melt.
Remove the patties from the heat and let them rest for a few minutes.
Toast the hamburger buns on the grill or in a toaster.
Assemble the burgers by placing a patty on the bottom half of each bun, and adding lettuce, tomato, onion, and your preferred condiments on top.
Cover with the top half of the bun and serve the classic cheeseburgers immediately.

recipes.name: BBQ Ribs
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium heat.
Season the ribs with salt and pepper on both sides.
In a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar, paprika, chili powder, garlic powder, and onion powder to make a dry rub.
Rub the dry rub mixture all over the ribs, coating them evenly.
Place the ribs on the grill and cook for about 1.5-2 hours, or until they are tender and the meat easily pulls away from the bone.
During the last 15 minutes of cooking, brush the ribs with BBQ sauce on both sides.
Remove the ribs from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
Slice the ribs between the bones and serve them with additional BBQ sauce on the side.
Enjoy the flavorful and tender BBQ ribs!

recipes.name: Apple Pie
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Place one pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish and press it gently against the bottom and sides.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the sliced apples, granulated sugar, flour, ground cinnamon, salt, and lemon juice. Toss until the apples are evenly coated.
Pour the apple mixture into the pie crust-lined dish. Dot the top of the apples with the small pieces of butter.
Place the second pie crust over the apple filling. Trim any excess crust and crimp the edges to seal the pie.
Cut slits or create a decorative pattern on the top crust to allow steam to escape during baking.
Brush the beaten egg over the top crust for a shiny finish. Sprinkle the tablespoon of granulated sugar over the top.
Place the pie dish on a baking sheet to catch any potential spills and transfer it to the preheated oven.
Bake for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 375°F (190°C). Continue baking for an additional 40-45 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
Once baked, remove the pie from the oven and allow it to cool on a wire rack for at least 2 hours to allow the filling to set.
Slice and serve the delicious homemade apple pie on its own or with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Enjoy the classic American dessert!
